param.name: io.il
param.label: A list of input images.
param.help: A list of input images. The following data types are allowed in the txt file: png, jpeg, tiff

param.name: io.vd
param.label: A list of vector data to select the training samples.
param.help: A list of vector data to select the training samples. The following data types are allowed in the txt file: vnd.google-earth.kml+xml, xml, json, zip

param.name: io.valid
param.label: A list of vector data to select the validation samples.
param.help: A list of vector data to select the validation samples. The following data types are allowed in the txt file: vnd.google-earth.kml+xml, xml, json, zip

param.name: io.imstat
param.label: XML file containing mean and variance of each feature.
param.help: XML file containing mean and variance of each feature. The following data types are allowed in the txt file: xml

param.name: cleanup
param.label: If activated, the application will try to clean all temporary files it created
param.help: If activated, the application will try to clean all temporary files it created

param.name: sample.mt
param.label: Maximum size per class (in pixels) of the training sample list (default = 1000) (no limit = -1). If equal to -1, then the maximal size of the available training sample list per class will be equal to the surface area of the smallest class multiplied by the training sample ratio.
param.help: Maximum size per class (in pixels) of the training sample list (default = 1000) (no limit = -1). If equal to -1, then the maximal size of the available training sample list per class will be equal to the surface area of the smallest class multiplied by the training sample ratio.

param.name: sample.mv
param.label: Maximum size per class (in pixels) of the validation sample list (default = 1000) (no limit = -1). If equal to -1, then the maximal size of the available validation sample list per class will be equal to the surface area of the smallest class multiplied by the validation sample ratio.
param.help: Maximum size per class (in pixels) of the validation sample list (default = 1000) (no limit = -1). If equal to -1, then the maximal size of the available validation sample list per class will be equal to the surface area of the smallest class multiplied by the validation sample ratio.

param.name: sample.bm
param.label: Bound the number of samples for each class by the number of available samples by the smaller class. Proportions between training and validation are respected. Default is true (=1).
param.help: Bound the number of samples for each class by the number of available samples by the smaller class. Proportions between training and validation are respected. Default is true (=1).

param.name: sample.vtr
param.label: Ratio between training and validation samples (0.0 = all training, 1.0 = all validation) (default = 0.5).
param.help: Ratio between training and validation samples (0.0 = all training, 1.0 = all validation) (default = 0.5).

param.name: sample.vfn
param.label: Field containing the class id for supervision. The values in this field shall be cast into integers.
param.help: Field containing the class id for supervision. The values in this field shall be cast into integers.

param.name: ram
param.label: Available memory for processing (in MB)
param.help: Available memory for processing (in MB)

param.name: elev.dem
param.label: This parameter allows selecting a directory containing Digital Elevation Model files. Note that this directory should contain only DEM files. Unexpected behaviour might occurs if other images are found in this directory.
param.help: This parameter allows selecting a directory containing Digital Elevation Model files. Note that this directory should contain only DEM files. Unexpected behaviour might occurs if other images are found in this directory.

param.name: elev.geoid
param.label: Use a geoid grid to get the height above the ellipsoid in case there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles. A version of the geoid can be found on the OTB website(https://gitlab.orfeo-toolbox.org/orfeotoolbox/otb-data/blob/master/Input/DEM/egm96.grd).
param.help: Use a geoid grid to get the height above the ellipsoid in case there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles. A version of the geoid can be found on the OTB website(https://gitlab.orfeo-toolbox.org/orfeotoolbox/otb-data/blob/master/Input/DEM/egm96.grd). The following data types are allowed in the txt file: octet-stream

param.name: elev.default
param.label: This parameter allows setting the default height above ellipsoid when there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles, and no geoid file has been set. This is also used by some application as an average elevation value.
param.help: This parameter allows setting the default height above ellipsoid when there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles, and no geoid file has been set. This is also used by some application as an average elevation value.

param.name: classifier
param.label: Choice of the classifier to use for the training.
param.help: Choice of the classifier to use for the training.

param.name: classifier.libsvm.k
param.label: SVM Kernel Type.
param.help: SVM Kernel Type.

param.name: classifier.libsvm.m
param.label: Type of SVM formulation.
param.help: Type of SVM formulation.

param.name: classifier.libsvm.c
param.label: SVM models have a cost parameter C (1 by default) to control the trade-off between training errors and forcing rigid margins.
param.help: SVM models have a cost parameter C (1 by default) to control the trade-off between training errors and forcing rigid margins.

param.name: classifier.libsvm.nu
param.label: Cost parameter Nu, in the range 0..1, the larger the value, the smoother the decision.
param.help: Cost parameter Nu, in the range 0..1, the larger the value, the smoother the decision.

param.name: classifier.libsvm.opt
param.label: SVM parameters optimization flag.
param.help: SVM parameters optimization flag.

param.name: classifier.libsvm.prob
param.label: Probability estimation flag.
param.help: Probability estimation flag.

param.name: classifier.boost.t
param.label: Type of Boosting algorithm.
param.help: Type of Boosting algorithm.

param.name: classifier.boost.w
param.label: The number of weak classifiers.
param.help: The number of weak classifiers.

param.name: classifier.boost.r
param.label: A threshold between 0 and 1 used to save computational time. Samples with summary weight <= (1 - weight_trim_rate) do not participate in the next iteration of training. Set this parameter to 0 to turn off this functionality.
param.help: A threshold between 0 and 1 used to save computational time. Samples with summary weight <= (1 - weight_trim_rate) do not participate in the next iteration of training. Set this parameter to 0 to turn off this functionality.

param.name: classifier.boost.m
param.label: Maximum depth of the tree.
param.help: Maximum depth of the tree.

param.name: classifier.dt.max
param.label: The training algorithm attempts to split each node while its depth is smaller than the maximum possible depth of the tree. The actual depth may be smaller if the other termination criteria are met, and/or if the tree is pruned.
param.help: The training algorithm attempts to split each node while its depth is smaller than the maximum possible depth of the tree. The actual depth may be smaller if the other termination criteria are met, and/or if the tree is pruned.

param.name: classifier.dt.min
param.label: If the number of samples in a node is smaller than this parameter, then this node will not be split.
param.help: If the number of samples in a node is smaller than this parameter, then this node will not be split.

param.name: classifier.dt.ra
param.label: If all absolute differences between an estimated value in a node and the values of the train samples in this node are smaller than this regression accuracy parameter, then the node will not be split further.
param.help: If all absolute differences between an estimated value in a node and the values of the train samples in this node are smaller than this regression accuracy parameter, then the node will not be split further.

param.name: classifier.dt.cat
param.label: Cluster possible values of a categorical variable into K <= cat clusters to find a suboptimal split.
param.help: Cluster possible values of a categorical variable into K <= cat clusters to find a suboptimal split.

param.name: classifier.dt.f
param.label: If cv_folds > 1, then it prunes a tree with K-fold cross-validation where K is equal to cv_folds.
param.help: If cv_folds > 1, then it prunes a tree with K-fold cross-validation where K is equal to cv_folds.

param.name: classifier.dt.r
param.label: If true, then a pruning will be harsher. This will make a tree more compact and more resistant to the training data noise but a bit less accurate.
param.help: If true, then a pruning will be harsher. This will make a tree more compact and more resistant to the training data noise but a bit less accurate.

param.name: classifier.dt.t
param.label: If true, then pruned branches are physically removed from the tree.
param.help: If true, then pruned branches are physically removed from the tree.

param.name: classifier.ann.t
param.label: Type of training method for the multilayer perceptron (MLP) neural network.
param.help: Type of training method for the multilayer perceptron (MLP) neural network.

param.name: classifier.ann.sizes
param.label: The number of neurons in each intermediate layer (excluding input and output layers).
param.help: The number of neurons in each intermediate layer (excluding input and output layers).

param.name: classifier.ann.f
param.label: This function determine whether the output of the node is positive or not depending on the output of the transfert function.
param.help: This function determine whether the output of the node is positive or not depending on the output of the transfert function.

param.name: classifier.ann.a

param.name: classifier.ann.b
param.label: Beta parameter of the activation function (used only with sigmoid and gaussian functions).
param.help: Beta parameter of the activation function (used only with sigmoid and gaussian functions).

param.name: classifier.ann.bpdw
param.label: Strength of the weight gradient term in the BACKPROP method. The recommended value is about 0.1.
param.help: Strength of the weight gradient term in the BACKPROP method. The recommended value is about 0.1.

param.name: classifier.ann.bpms
param.label: Strength of the momentum term (the difference between weights on the 2 previous iterations). This parameter provides some inertia to smooth the random fluctuations of the weights. It can vary from 0 (the feature is disabled) to 1 and beyond. The value 0.1 or so is good enough.
param.help: Strength of the momentum term (the difference between weights on the 2 previous iterations). This parameter provides some inertia to smooth the random fluctuations of the weights. It can vary from 0 (the feature is disabled) to 1 and beyond. The value 0.1 or so is good enough.

param.name: classifier.ann.rdw
param.label: Initial value Delta_0 of update-values Delta_
param.help: Initial value Delta_0 of update-values Delta_

param.name: classifier.ann.rdwm
param.label: Update-values lower limit Delta_
param.help: Update-values lower limit Delta_

param.name: classifier.ann.term
param.label: Termination criteria.
param.help: Termination criteria.

param.name: classifier.ann.eps
param.label: Epsilon value used in the Termination criteria.
param.help: Epsilon value used in the Termination criteria.

param.name: classifier.ann.iter
param.label: Maximum number of iterations used in the Termination criteria.
param.help: Maximum number of iterations used in the Termination criteria.

param.name: classifier.rf.max
param.label: The depth of the tree. A low value will likely underfit and conversely a high value will likely overfit. The optimal value can be obtained using cross validation or other suitable methods.
param.help: The depth of the tree. A low value will likely underfit and conversely a high value will likely overfit. The optimal value can be obtained using cross validation or other suitable methods.

param.name: classifier.rf.min
param.label: If the number of samples in a node is smaller than this parameter, then the node will not be split. A reasonable value is a small percentage of the total data e.g. 1 percent.
param.help: If the number of samples in a node is smaller than this parameter, then the node will not be split. A reasonable value is a small percentage of the total data e.g. 1 percent.

param.name: classifier.rf.ra
param.label: If all absolute differences between an estimated value in a node and the values of the train samples in this node are smaller than this regression accuracy parameter, then the node will not be split.
param.help: If all absolute differences between an estimated value in a node and the values of the train samples in this node are smaller than this regression accuracy parameter, then the node will not be split.

param.name: classifier.rf.cat
param.label: Cluster possible values of a categorical variable into K <= cat clusters to find a suboptimal split.

param.label: The size of the subset of features, randomly selected at each tree node, that are used to find the best split(s). If you set it to 0, then the size will be set to the square root of the total number of features.
param.help: The size of the subset of features, randomly selected at each tree node, that are used to find the best split(s). If you set it to 0, then the size will be set to the square root of the total number of features.

Also to keep in mind, increasing the number of trees increases the prediction time linearly.

tool.help: This application performs a classifier training from multiple pairs of input images and training vector data. Samples are composed of pixel values in each band optionally centered and reduced using an XML statistics file produced by the ComputeImagesStatistics application. The training vector data must contain polygons with a positive integer field representing the class label. The name of this field can be set using the "Class label field" parameter. Training and validation sample lists are built such that each class is equally represented in both lists. One parameter allows controlling the ratio between the number of samples in training and validation sets. Two parameters allow managing the size of the training and validation sets per class and per image. Several classifier parameters can be set depending on the chosen classifier. In the validation process, the confusion matrix is organized the following way: rows = reference labels, columns = produced labels. In the header of the optional confusion matrix output file, the validation (reference) and predicted (produced) class labels are ordered according to the rows/columns of the confusion matrix. This application is based on LibSVM, OpenCV Machine Learning (2.3.1 and later), and Shark ML. The output of this application is a text model file, whose format corresponds to the ML model type chosen. There is no image nor vector data output.
